body: Ping @jasongrout since you requested me to open this early.
Thanks!
looking this over, what's the rationale for when to capitalize and when to lowercase the first letter? (e.g. IPython vs ipython and Utils vs utils)
Upercase are modules/classes, lowercase should be instances.
^ What he said
I wouldn't uppercase modules, we don't normally do that (not that there really is such a thing as modules in js).  So it makes more sense to me for `utils` to be lowercase.
Let see that another way. Uppercase name are things you can `require`. so I see the point of having Utils uppercase.

Utils being uppercase seems inconsistent to me, so I hope it doesn't stay that way.  Uppercase == require-able also doesn't make sense to me. require ~= import, and we don't capitalize module names anywhere else, and I don't think there's any precedence to capitalizing modules in js.
I'm either with @minrk on this, or confused, or both.
I understand why you are confused. All our javascript Module only define a single "Class" (Cell, Notebook...) so loading the module does load the Class.

> I'm either with @minrk on this, or confused, or both.

Hopefully the first one :wink: I think if we are to treat this ~= python import, it only makes sense to have lowercase utils, like @minrk  said.

So this is "working" now.  There's a couple of bugs here and there, and the test suite is failing miserably, but at least everything renders, you can run code,  etc...  I think I'm going to use https://github.com/auchenberg/dependo to take a look at the dependency graph (I'll post the results here).  There are still a couple things TODO, like moving the "backwards compatibility" code into the parent JS files.

Dynamic notebook JS dependency graph: http://jdfreder.github.io/
ping @ellisonbg who asked for this on the whiteboard.

I'll make a more permanent place for it when I get a chance (and I'll update the link here).

Comments from the dev meeting addressed, and all bugs I could find have been squashed.  I'm waiting to see what Travis thinks, but I'm guessing he will catch a couple more small things that I'll need to fix.
A few inline comment ! Good job !

@takluyver I'm having trouble getting Travis to install require.js and jquery for node (to fix the nbconvert api test failure).  `npm install jquery requirejs` doesn't seem to install them to a place that the node used by nbconvert can find, and `sudo npm install -g jquery requirejs` yields _npm not found_.  I think the sudoer env variable is screwed up on Travis, I had this problem when trying to get the slimer PR to run on it.  The solution there was to download npm and install it manually, getting rid of Pierre Carrier's PPA.

Pierre Carrier's PPA isn't relevant here - that supplies casper and phantom, while node and npm come from the main package repo. It looks like you've got that working now, though - only the casper tests are failing now.

> only the casper tests are failing now.

yup
@minrk @ellisonbg @takluyver I believe the most recent commit (4e120e7) has what we talked about in our hangout.  Still need to get the tests working...

OK I have done a line by line review. But before @jdfreder starts to address my comments, I will summarize (later today) some of the big questions that my review uncovered so we can discuss those later today or at the dev meeting tomorrow.

> But before @jdfreder starts to address my comments, I will summarize (later today) some of the big questions that my review uncovered so we can discuss those later today or at the dev meeting tomorrow.

I've addressed some of the comments (the trivial fixes, like typos) on my local machine, but haven't pushed yet.  @ellisonbg do you mind if I push these fixes?  They should only affect the comments corresponding to them, not the major discussion points you've mention in the review.
@ellisonbg with the last commit, the tests are all passing locally.  I still need to rebase to get the tests to pass on master, but this is ready for you to look through again.

This is rebased now, waiting on Travis...  
Also, the cell toolbars aren't working yet.  I'm looking into it now...

Cell toolbars are working, waiting on Travis once again, but it should pass just like the last commit.
This is ready for a review or merge.

Wow, I'll finally be able to use the IPython javascript in node for https://github.com/rgbkrk/atom-ipynb with less changes (I had to put all the IPython javascript together to get the IPython namespace to work right before).

@ellisonbg - Apparently you've said you'll do another review pass on this, so I've assigned it to you.

@jdfreder - It currently has merge conflicts, so you'll need to rebase at some point. It might make sense to wait until after review, in case new conflicts come up in the meantime.

Sorry, @jdfreder, but this conflicts with your own #5963 which you just asked me to merge.

I had a read through, and it's looking pretty good. I think the only outstanding questions are:
- use options everywhere or just where more than a few args are needed
- whether to use require abbreviations for all components, or just those that need shims

The argument for using options, even when there are only a few arguments now, is that it makes it easier to avoid breaking the API in the future. Adding a kwarg to options is less disruptive than switching from positional to kwargs once there are enough arguments to do so.

I think both of these can be addressed in later, smaller PRs., and this PR is okay to merge once @jdfreder gets it back to a mergeable state.
